intro: Pilosella trochocnemia, commonly known as the woolly leafed mouse-ear, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its dense, woolly covering on the stems and leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, often found in grassy areas and rocky soils. Pilosella trochocnemia is typically perennial and thrives in temperate climates.
